Linting and Formatting

Setting up linters and code formatters is really important to group projects. When people are doing things like using different kinds of quotes, or people are following different semicolon rules, code

# 

<span key="73b53fdd69314a32b2dd0d61d27d3ee3"><span offset-key="73b53fdd69314a32b2dd0d61d27d3ee3:0">Linting and Formatting</span></span>

## 

<span key="b5870a0043534a7590f7c16ac1951359"><span offset-key="b5870a0043534a7590f7c16ac1951359:0">Setting Up ESLint And Prettier</span></span>

<span key="1c8531618c6f415ba6d2940d3bd0dc89"><span offset-key="1c8531618c6f415ba6d2940d3bd0dc89:0">eslint and prettier</span></span>

### 

<span key="2652ae1c2bc249d7ab7aaddd8a18f6dd"><span offset-key="2652ae1c2bc249d7ab7aaddd8a18f6dd:0">Objective</span></span>

<span key="1567d67f0c9f4f35a0d9ce25ef31aa34"><span offset-key="1567d67f0c9f4f35a0d9ce25ef31aa34:0">Setting up linters and code formatters is really important to group projects. When people are doing things like using different kinds of quotes, or people are following different semicolon rules, code can become a confusing mess real quick. Adding things like code formatters and linters can be really beneficial to building a uniform and readable code base. This guide aims to help you easily set these things up in your groups project.</span></span>

<span key="9f254029f2944236ac91c68d2b647436">**Technologies Discussed**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="400965f4a4ec44caa73f1cba3acd2da6"><span offset-key="400965f4a4ec44caa73f1cba3acd2da6:0">ESLint</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="aa411abc1801429bb383739a1d079deb"><span offset-key="aa411abc1801429bb383739a1d079deb:0">Prettier</span></span>

### 

<span key="add0eee342ea4d53980e1e6aa487a86f"><span offset-key="add0eee342ea4d53980e1e6aa487a86f:0">Install ESLint and Prettier VS Code Extensions</span></span>

<span key="cc728b9d3620421ebc401fb8c1e869b4"><span offset-key="cc728b9d3620421ebc401fb8c1e869b4:0">Make sure every team member has </span></span><a href="https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=esbenp.prettier-vscode" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="df5d428a0b654f4496d74c1ab8dfc46c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-41445_259-41446-237__"><span data-key="3e2d95f3fc084518a866d5e8bddbb7e3"><span data-offset-key="3e2d95f3fc084518a866d5e8bddbb7e3:0">prettier</span></span></span></a><span key="f7b38233840c4a94b916b787641c2a54"><span offset-key="f7b38233840c4a94b916b787641c2a54:0"> and </span></span><a href="https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=dbaeumer.vscode-eslint" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f394ee28299d45b080251864dfbd47f7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-41445_259-41446-237__"><span data-key="57f886a474554bd790a51597c62f410b"><span data-offset-key="57f886a474554bd790a51597c62f410b:0">eslint</span></span></span></a><span key="54174a84eac246ee9b01d1a281220f7a"><span offset-key="54174a84eac246ee9b01d1a281220f7a:0"> VS Code extension's installed.</span></span>

<span key="ac21f801b1564d0580b81bc88c102834"><span offset-key="ac21f801b1564d0580b81bc88c102834:0">By default, most Labs projects will have both already in the </span>`DevDependancies`<span offset-key="ac21f801b1564d0580b81bc88c102834:2">with a Labs config in place. In these cases you can simply run </span>`npm run lint`<span offset-key="ac21f801b1564d0580b81bc88c102834:4"> to view any errors or warnings and </span>`npm run lint:fix`<span offset-key="ac21f801b1564d0580b81bc88c102834:6"> will attempt to fix them</span></span>

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

<span key="7a54a5dc232d491a979662d13a3f53e3"><span offset-key="7a54a5dc232d491a979662d13a3f53e3:0">It's recommended to turn "Format On Save" on. Click on prettier link above and search for "Format On Save" for instructions on setting that up in vs code. Also, check out section "Linter Integration". üî•</span></span>

### 

<span key="5df268399e024243b945bc35ee10b3a8"><span offset-key="5df268399e024243b945bc35ee10b3a8:0">Configure ESLint and Prettier</span></span>

<span key="1c64b918baa54c69b09f102bd7c7e426"><span offset-key="1c64b918baa54c69b09f102bd7c7e426:0">Now we need to add dependencies to our project with some rc files! Woo hoo! üëè</span></span>

<span key="125d56ad5fdd4aaa85a879afcbc39427"><span offset-key="125d56ad5fdd4aaa85a879afcbc39427:0">In the root of your project's directory run:</span></span>

<span key="9cda7163c7604515b5310ddf10cf26da">`npm i eslint prettier eslint-config-prettier eslint-plugin-prettier`</span>

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

<span key="b206d018ff874cbdbedd13b937a08097"><span offset-key="b206d018ff874cbdbedd13b937a08097:0">For react apps, add </span>`eslint-plugin-react`<span offset-key="b206d018ff874cbdbedd13b937a08097:2"> to dependencies as well! Then we can add a file named </span>`.eslintrc.js`<span offset-key="b206d018ff874cbdbedd13b937a08097:4"> with the following content for a react app.</span></span>

<span key="4657fc308e034b1b96768c9e3533b3b1"><span offset-key="4657fc308e034b1b96768c9e3533b3b1:0"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="4657fc308e034b1b96768c9e3533b3b1:1">"lint:fix"</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="4657fc308e034b1b96768c9e3533b3b1:2">:</span><span offset-key="4657fc308e034b1b96768c9e3533b3b1:3"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="4657fc308e034b1b96768c9e3533b3b1:4">"eslint --fix ."</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="4657fc308e034b1b96768c9e3533b3b1:5">,</span></span>

<span key="5b0c87c5eac04f86984f0cc6042a3923"><span offset-key="5b0c87c5eac04f86984f0cc6042a3923:0"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5b0c87c5eac04f86984f0cc6042a3923:1">"format"</span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5b0c87c5eac04f86984f0cc6042a3923:2">:</span><span offset-key="5b0c87c5eac04f86984f0cc6042a3923:3"> </span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="5b0c87c5eac04f86984f0cc6042a3923:4">"prettier --write \\"\*\*/\*.+(js|jsx|json|yml|yaml|css|md)\\""</span></span>

6

<span key="e4ae8cdef0314c2b8660c07e8b6baad9"><span offset-key="e4ae8cdef0314c2b8660c07e8b6baad9:0"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="e4ae8cdef0314c2b8660c07e8b6baad9:1">}</span></span>

7

<span key="d0db0502e1ee43afb1e13dc05d134784"><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="d0db0502e1ee43afb1e13dc05d134784:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

### 

<span key="609b22f336744edaa1705bcf7a38723b"><span offset-key="609b22f336744edaa1705bcf7a38723b:0">Conclusion</span></span>

<span key="304c4c11520d44f6bb72e9019d57dfe5"><span offset-key="304c4c11520d44f6bb72e9019d57dfe5:0">Setting up ESLint and Prettier in your projects can go a long way in helping you write better, more readable code. Even more so when you're working in a team environment.</span></span>

<span key="e30a163282dd4885a831f1104d32fb87"><span offset-key="e30a163282dd4885a831f1104d32fb87:0">You may have noticed that the "rules" key's where empty in the .eslintrc examples. ESLint does a lot by default but if you want more in-depth, fine grain control over the coding style for your project visit their </span></span><a href="https://eslint.org/docs/rules/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="819c86cdf62a440d85718bf6105f1cb7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-41445_259-41446-237__"><span data-key="48ca627626784797afad5af1c1582e83"><span data-offset-key="48ca627626784797afad5af1c1582e83:0">docs on rules here!</span></span></span></a><span key="d1174a6c9da1486f84c8f0262def3a8f"><span offset-key="d1174a6c9da1486f84c8f0262def3a8f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">‚Äã</span></span></span>
